MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA," the text "PRIVATE ISLANDS" appears in smaller uppercase letters, followed by "MALDIVES" in even smaller uppercase letters. • Above the text, there is a stylized red brushstroke forming a loose, upward curve or wave-like shape. Dimensions & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the word "NIYAMA." • All text is center-aligned beneath the graphic element. Analysis : • The logo uses a minimalist design with a red accent to evoke a sense of luxury and exclusivity, consistent with a high-end resort or private island branding. Summary : This set of three photographs showcases a luxury tropical island resort, highlighting its pristine natural setting, opulent interior accommodations, and a unique underwater dining experience. photo: Scene Overview : • The first image (left) is an aerial view of a small, lush island surrounded by turquoise blue shallow waters and white sandy beaches, with a long pier extending from the island to overwater villas. • The second image (center) shows the interior of a spacious, high-ceilinged, open-plan living room with modern white furnishings, large windows, and a direct view of the beach and ocean beyond. • The third image (right) depicts an underwater restaurant with floor-to-ceiling glass walls revealing a vibrant aquatic scene with fish swimming outside; the dining area features elegant tables, black textured chairs, and a ceiling decorated with hanging white elements. Technical Details : • Lighting is bright and natural in the first two images, with the third image illuminated by both ambient light and the blue glow from the surrounding water. • No scale bars or measurement references are present. • No visible text or signage in any of the images. Spatial Relationships : • The aerial view establishes the island’s isolation and the layout of the resort, including the pier and overwater structures. • The living room is positioned to maximize the ocean view, with furniture arranged to face the open windows. • The underwater restaurant places diners in close proximity to marine life, with the glass walls providing an immersive experience. Analysis : • The images collectively emphasize exclusivity, luxury, and a close connection to both natural beauty and unique architectural features. The underwater restaurant stands out as a distinctive attraction, while the overall setting suggests a high-end vacation destination. 3 NIGHTS MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE

- **1. Accommodation Rate Definition** - • Valid for Middle East & GCC Market Only. - • Book by period: 30th Sept 2025 - • Package rates are quoted in US Dollars and based on standard occupancy for 3 nights per villa/pavilion including return transfers for, - ◦ All Villas and One Bedroom Pavilions - Includes return transfers for 02 people - ◦ Two Bedroom Pavilions - includes return transfers for 04 people - ◦ Three Bedroom Pavilion - includes return transfers for 06 people - • Rates are inclusive of Breakfast & Dinner at Epicure or BLU subject to restaurant operations. - • Still water, tea and coffee are included during meals. - • Combinable with Honeymoon/Anniversary/Birthday - • All rates are net inclusive of 16% TGST, 10% Service Charge and Green tax based on the Standard Occupancy. - • Offer is subject to availability, stop sales and length of stay restrictions upon resort's discretion with a 48 hrs notice period. - • This Middle East Package supersedes any existing package. - • All villas are on free sale while Pavilions are on request basis. P2 MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA" are the words "PRIVATE ISLANDS" and "MALDIVES" in smaller, spaced-out uppercase letters. • Above the text is a stylized, red, brushstroke-like curved line resembling the letter "N" or a wave. Design & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the text. • All text is center-aligned. • The overall design is minimalistic, using only black and red on a white background. Analysis : • The logo uses a clean, modern aesthetic with a distinctive red brushstroke to create a memorable brand identity for NIYAMA Private Islands Maldives, likely evoking a sense of luxury and exclusivity. 2. **Exclusive Benefits** - • One-time Complimentary Floating Breakfast experience during the stay for Beach Pool Villa and upwards. - for stays on Beach Villa and Deluxe Beach Villa, it will be a one time in villa breakfast experience instead. - • One-time Shisha experience either at Blu Restaurant or Dune Bar during the stay per villa. - • One-time Complimentary Lucky Dolphin Cruise during the stay - **for stays of 4 nights and above only** - • 20 mints photo session with snap studio with 02 colour corrected digital images, delivered by e-mail (no print) - **for stays of 4 nights and above only** - 3. Other Complimentary Services - • Personalized bicycles for adults and children - • Tea & Nespresso facilities in the Villas - • 24 hours shared Thakuru (host) service with buggy & bookings assistance - • Popcorn machine & popcorn in the Villas - • Daily replenishment of ice cream in the Villas - • Bottles of water per villa per day - • Flip flops & indoor slippers - • WI-FI access - • Complimentary Twice a week evening yoga session - • Usage of Active facilities (Game Center) excluding private Indoor Cinema - • 24 hours fitness facility (Pump) - • Scheduled activities (i.e: Aqua Zumba, HIIT, etc) - • Access to the Tennis court - • Surfing at Vodi (exclusive surf spot at Play Island) - • Access to Lair (Library & Business Centre) with water, tea & Nespresso - • Access to the steam room and sauna at Drift Spa by Niyama - • Non-motorized water sports activities (Kayaking, Snorkeling) - • Snorkeling equipment - 4. Additional Person Policy - **Infant stays for free (Age 0 to 1.99 years)** - • Stay for free. Baby-cot available upon on request and required to be booked in advance. - • Complimentary meals on infant menu at all outlets. - • Complimentary return Seaplane or Domestic transfer. - **Child (Age 2 years to 11.99 years)** - USD 61 charge per child per night when travelling with parents in the same room. - • Accommodation with service charge, TGST and green tax as well as breakfast, lunch and dinner on kids’ menu in all restaurants (except Subsix) - • Kids Club access for three age groups (Adventurers, Voyagers & Pioneers) from 9am to 6pm. Tailor made activities (explore marine life, Master Chef classes etc.). - • Access to professional and fully qualified child carers recruited and trained by Scott Dunn, supported by a trained local team. Complimentary bikes. - • Offers are not applicable on child fee. - **Third Adult (Age 12 years and above).** - USD 206 charge is applicable per person per night rate includes: - • Service charge, TGST and green tax. - • Breakfast and Dinner except Peak Season. Dinner Supplement during 23rd Dec 2025 to 08th Jan 2026 would be USD 135 nett per person per day (except 24th & 31st Dec 2025) P3 MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA PRIVATE ISLANDS MALDIVES Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, black, uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA" are the words "PRIVATE ISLANDS" and "MALDIVES" in smaller, uppercase black letters, stacked vertically. • Above the text is a stylized, red, brushstroke-like curved line resembling the letter "N" or a wave. Design & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the text. • All text is centered and uses a clean, sans-serif font. • The overall layout is vertical, with the graphic element on top and text below. Analysis : • The logo uses a minimalistic and modern design, with the red brushstroke adding a dynamic, tropical or oceanic feel, appropriate for a luxury island resort brand. - • Third person is subject to maximum occupancy and bedding allocation. 5. 6. Meal plan HALF BOARD
Included in the rate
  • Breakfast & Dinner are available at Epicure or BLU subject to restaurant operations.
  • USD 70 net food credit per adult per night is available for dinner at Tribal, Nest & Edge.
  • Food credit is not applicable on Destination Dining, In-villa Dining, The Deli Food Truck at Surf Shack and Subsix or other special events.
**LUNCH SUPPLEMENT** USD 55 Net per person per night - • Three-course lunch (Appetizer + Main Course + Dessert) at [BLU](#) or [Dune](#) (food menu only) subject to restaurant operations. - • Option of light lunch at the Deli of Food truck at Surf Shack (up to 2 items from menu - guests choice) - • USD 55 net food credit per adult per day is applicable when having lunch at [Nest](#) Teppanyaki. **The restaurants are hyperlinked to the 360 virtual tour. ***All meal plans are combinable with any of our beverage package. 7. P4 MIDDLE EAST PACKAGE RATE FROM 01 AUG – 22 DEC 2025 APPLICABLE FOR NEW BOOKINGS RECEIVED FROM 01 AUG 2025 logo: NIYAMA Private Islands Maldives Visible Elements : • The logo features the word "NIYAMA" in large, bold, black uppercase letters. • Below "NIYAMA," the text "PRIVATE ISLANDS" appears in smaller uppercase letters, followed by "MALDIVES" in even smaller uppercase letters. • Above the text, there is a stylized red brushstroke forming a loose, upward-arching curve, resembling an abstract "N" or wave. Dimensions & Placement : • The red brushstroke is centered above the word "NIYAMA." • All text is center-aligned beneath the brushstroke. • The logo is on a white background. Analysis : • The logo uses a minimalist design with a bold, modern font and a single red accent, likely to convey luxury and exclusivity. • The brushstroke adds a dynamic, artistic element, possibly referencing waves or the natural beauty of the Maldives. - • The direct journey is approximately 45 minutes each way. One stopover might occur, and guest will be advised prior to take off. - • Guests will have access to the Niyama Lounge with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages & snacks (opening hours 6.30 am to 8.30 pm). - • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport. - • Transfers by seaplane are available during daylight hours only. Guests arriving at Male airport after 3:15 pm shall be advised to book a domestic flight or arrange overnight accommodation and will be transferred to the resort the following morning. - • The journey is approximately 30 minutes per way + 5 minutes by speedboat. - • Price is inclusive of complimentary return speedboat transfer between Dhaalu Domestic Airport and the resort. - • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport. - • International flight details must be provided **5 days** prior to arrival for High, Low & Shoulder Season. For Peak Season, international flight details must be received **30 days** prior to arrival. - • Departing guests will be transferred to the airport at least 3 hours prior to the scheduled international flight departure, with the last seaplane departing from the island at 3:00pm. - • Domestic & Seaplane transfers are managed by a third-party company thus it will be subject to availability and may be cancelled due to weather conditions or operational reasons. In this case, arrangements will be done for the guest on the next best available flight. - • Schedule of domestic flights can be communicated a week prior to arrival, while for seaplane transfers it will be communicated to the guest the day prior to their arrival/departure from the resort. - • Niyama Private Islands Maldives is not accountable for any delays or cancellations due to the local domestic flight carrier or seaplane operator. - • 100% fees will be applicable in case of no show or cancellation. - • Rate is subject to change without prior notice as per the service provider. Design & Placement : • The red brushstroke is positioned above the word "NIYAMA," slightly tilted and dynamic. • All text is horizontally aligned and centered. • The overall logo is on a white background. Analysis : • The logo combines modern, clean typography with a dynamic red brushstroke, possibly evoking a sense of movement, luxury, or the natural beauty of the Maldives. 8. To read the statement that you have now acknowledged, we kindly ask you to visit our website and the link below: https://www.niyama.com/en/privacy-statement Summary : This image shows a signature block section from a contract or agreement form, with fields for both a partner and a resort, including names, roles, a signature, and a date. signature: Andre Bernardo, right-slanted, with a flourish and underline, medium stroke weight # Signature Placement : • The signature appears in the "RESORT" column, next to "Director of Sales & Marketing: Andre Bernardo". • The signature is right-slanted, with a flourish and underline, and medium stroke weight. • No signature is present in the "PARTNER" column. # Associated Names and Roles : • Director of Sales & Marketing: Andre Bernardo (signed) • Financial Controller: Ibrahim Rafyf • General Manager: Hafidh Al Busaidy # Date : • Date: 31st Jul 2025 (in the "RESORT" column) # Table Structure : • Two main columns: "PARTNER" and "RESORT", with red headers. • Rows for Product Manager/Contractor, signature, and date. Analysis : • The signature of Andre Bernardo is present, indicating authorization from the resort side. The partner side is unsigned. The table is structured for dual-party agreement, with clear role assignments and a specified date for execution. P7

- 4. Additional Person Policy

- **Infant stays for free (Age 0 to 1.99 years)**
  - • Stay for free. Baby-cot available upon on request and required to be booked in advance.
  - • Complimentary meals on infant menu at all outlets.
  - • Complimentary return Seaplane or Domestic transfer.

- **Child (Age 2 years to 11.99 years)**
  - USD 61 charge per child per night when travelling with parents in the same room.
  - • Accommodation with service charge, TGST and green tax as well as breakfast, lunch and dinner on kids’ menu in all restaurants (except Subsix)
  - • Kids Club access for three age groups (Adventurers, Voyagers & Pioneers) from 9am to 6pm. Tailor made activities (explore marine life, Master Chef classes etc.).
  - • Access to professional and fully qualified child carers recruited and trained by Scott Dunn, supported by a trained local team. Complimentary bikes.
  - • Offers are not applicable on child fee.

- **Third Adult (Age 12 years and above).**
  - USD 206 charge is applicable per person per night rate includes:
  - • Service charge, TGST and green tax.
  - • Breakfast and Dinner except Peak Season. Dinner Supplement during 23rd Dec 2025 to 08th Jan 2026 would be USD 135 nett per person per day (except 24th & 31st Dec 2025)

- • The direct journey is approximately 45 minutes each way. One stopover might occur, and guest will be advised prior to take off.
- • Guests will have access to the Niyama Lounge with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages & snacks (opening hours 6.30 am to 8.30 pm).
- • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport.
- • Transfers by seaplane are available during daylight hours only. Guests arriving at Male airport after 3:15 pm shall be advised to book a domestic flight or arrange overnight accommodation and will be transferred to the resort the following morning.

- • The journey is approximately 30 minutes per way + 5 minutes by speedboat.
- • Price is inclusive of complimentary return speedboat transfer between Dhaalu Domestic Airport and the resort.
- • Excess baggage is chargeable at **USD 5.80 per kg**, payable directly to the airline at the airport.

- • International flight details must be provided **5 days** prior to arrival for High, Low & Shoulder Season. For Peak Season, international flight details must be received **30 days** prior to arrival.
- • Departing guests will be transferred to the airport at least 3 hours prior to the scheduled international flight departure, with the last seaplane departing from the island at 3:00pm.
- • Domestic & Seaplane transfers are managed by a third-party company thus it will be subject to availability and may be cancelled due to weather conditions or operational reasons. In this case, arrangements will be done for the guest on the next best available flight.
- • Schedule of domestic flights can be communicated a week prior to arrival, while for seaplane transfers it will be communicated to the guest the day prior to their arrival/departure from the resort.
- • Niyama Private Islands Maldives is not accountable for any delays or cancellations due to the local domestic flight carrier or seaplane operator.
- • 100% fees will be applicable in case of no show or cancellation.
- • Rate is subject to change without prior notice as per the service provider.
